805719513580900352.text: How do we regulate transnationality? We build technology and deploy it transnationally- cf. US platforms, vs Chinese platforms #reclaim16

805718296301633536.text: Privacy compliance is not at the moment a compelling competitive advantage. We need to look deeper into the notion of autonomy.  #reclaim16

805716970024869888.text: If we want to reclaim autonomy we need to build an European infrastructure for data, instead of relying of US cloud services. #reclaim16

805716487939981312.text: Amazon cloud services host the data of all small startups which are trying to innovate beyond the incumbents. #reclaim16

805715070529503233.text: How much transparency we need? Is the accumulation of data necessary for economic growth? What are the alternatives? #reclaim16

805714692610125824.text: In the 21st century we generate wealth and economic growth through data collection and big data analysis.  #reclaim16

805714043856158720.text: Data wealth is the new political agenda.  Policy makers must account for both private interests and civil society needs.  #reclaim16

805713365628813312.text: Transparency is indispensable to regulate the digital world. Internal working of algorithms must be disclosed if they affect ppl. #reclaim16

805712429518831616.text: Must decide what shall be permitted and what not. Shall we allow a recording device in our living room? Even if people want it? #reclaim16

805711858271404033.text: Antitrust law doesn't help, what can we do to reclaim autonomy? Need to think about what kind of business model we want to allow. #reclaim16

805711506075688960.text: If we want to influence the design of these tech we need to do that add early as possible, before we fully lode control.  #reclaim16

805711233001332736.text: Concept of manipulation by algorithms extends beyond the notion of privacy.  We need new concepts to understand these threats. #reclaim16

805710874107383809.text: Privacy= construct created by society.  Doesn't make sense to have a concept of privacy that no longer works. We need new concept #reclaim16

805710440785383424.text: We carry silicon valley in or pockets, along with the silicon valley's own understanding of human rights.  #reclaim16

805709353592492032.text: Markets that are not dominated by competition should not be trusted.  States need to make sure that the market works well.  #reclaim16

805709112587812864.text: Everything is happening globally but we don't have a sovereign that can act globally. Who are the rules of new technologies? #reclaim16

805708675390337025.text: Economic power is now stronger than political power. Will it go to the detriment of the individual? How can we fight this power? #reclaim16

805708202901995520.text: Digital companies are powerful, what kind of power they have? Ppl elect governments, but today somebody else design or society.  #reclaim16

805707294382166016.text: New concepts are needed fir legal regulation to ensure proper ethics and morality in the digital age. #reclaim16

805706965489958912.text: The law has largely been deprived of its power due to 1. Transnationalisation and 2. Private charactet of internet platforms. #reclaim16

805706617056559104.text: Transnational governance requires coordinated self-regulation of multiple actors, but implementation is hard without regulation. #reclaim16

805706243499171840.text: Large enterprises on the internet often reject state regulation, and prefer self-regulation, cf Facebook code of conduct. #reclaim16

805705659836747776.text: Legal regulation on the Internet is limited by national boundaries. Technology are transnational but laws are territorial. #reclaim16

805705130364518400.text: Consent is needed to collect data, but consent goes beyond data protection, it also expands into warranties and legal issues. #reclaim16

805704418242994176.text: Google alphabet is entering into every field of activity.  Imperialism of silicon valley is becoming all the more visible today. #reclaim16

805704122548809728.text: Antitrust law cant save startups from assimilation by Internet giants, because they're too small to fall under merger regulations #reclaim16

805703857737232384.text: Google / Facebook act as spiders hunting the prey: with their web they can buy individuals startups and assimilate them if needed #reclaim16

805703494929891328.text: Conglomerate effects in the digital world lead to foreclosure of markets, preventing competition to emerge. #reclaim16

805703219326386176.text: Google / Facebook are the new power holders, with direct network effects that allow for an exponential increase of profits. #reclaim16

805702390519308288.text: Categories of good or bad is no use, the question is who use algorithms for behavioral control, and how to apply the rule of law. #reclaim16

805702141180542976.text: Algorithms are shaping our preferences, creating or breaking habits, nudging us towards particular behaviours, even in elections! #reclaim16

805701790213750784.text: Everyone is nowadays affected by algorithms influencing us unconsciously: feeds, autocomplete, recommendations, etc.  #reclaim16

805701308544090112.text: On Internet, we leave digital traces, which are processed through big data analytics: descriptive, predictive and prescriptive #reclaim16

805700811523321856.text: We are going "onlife" - both online and offline, our life is affected by digital technology, whether consciously or not. #reclaim16

805700386145374208.text: There are today many opportunities for surveillance and control, especially unconscious control with recommendations algorithms. #reclaim16
